output.final_deliverable:
I attempted the task but was unable to complete the required follow‑the‑links exploration because my attempts to open the chosen news article and the candidate source pages failed with HTTP fetch errors. Below I document what I did, what I found in the search results (these are the only items I could reliably obtain), the error(s) I encountered when trying to open pages, and recommended next steps.

1) Search (performed)
- Query used: "recent news article climate change links to study government policy organization \"climate change\" \"news\" \"linked\"" (intent: find a recent news article that includes outbound links to a scientific paper/study, a government policy document, and an organization position statement).
- Selected search-result candidates returned by the search (I can cite these search-result URLs but could not open any article pages to verify their outbound links):
  - Washington Post — Climate Politics & Policy: https://www.washingtonpost.com/climate-environment/climate-policy/ [search result]
  - Nature — Climate-change policy (Latest research and news): https://www.nature.com/subjects/climate-change-policy [search result]
  - FSC (Forest Stewardship Council) blog — "9 good news stories about climate change in 2025": https://fsc.org/en/blog/good-climate-news [search result]
  - BBC — "What is climate change? A really simple guide": https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c9w15nggj58o [search result]

Note: these URLs come from the initial search results I obtained. I have not been able to fetch the pages to inspect their content or outbound links.

2) Attempt to open the selected news article and follow links (failed)
- I attempted to visit the selected news article (the URL was chosen from step 1), but the HTTP fetch failed. Error returned: "HTTP fetch failed: URL chosen from step 1 (the selected news article) status=None". This prevented extracting outbound links or following them.
- I then attempted to open up to three candidate source URLs (intended to be the scientific paper, the government policy document, and the organization position statement) in parallel, but that attempt also failed with: "HTTP fetch failed: Up to three candidate URLs selected from step 2 (one for each type). status=None."

3) Consequence
- Because I could not open the news article, I could not extract its outbound links and therefore could not locate or verify (a) a scientific research paper/study cited by the article, (b) a government policy document cited by the article, or (c) an organization position statement cited by the article. I will not guess or invent these linkages — the evidence is missing.

4) Exploration path (log of steps and statuses)
- Step: Search for a recent news article about climate change that links to sources — SUCCESS. (I obtained the search results and URLs listed above.)
- Step: Visit the selected news article and extract outbound links & context — FAILED (HTTP fetch failed). Error message recorded.
- Step: Visit the candidate source URLs (paper, policy doc, organization statement) in parallel — FAILED (HTTP fetch failed).
- Step: Summarize each source and explain relation to original article — NOT COMPLETED (could not fetch sources).

5) What I can provide now (without opening pages)
- The candidate news/source URLs from the initial search results (see section 1). I can proceed if you choose one of those as the starting news article, or provide a specific news-article URL to use.

6) Recommended next steps (choose one)
- Option A: I retry the same process now (I will attempt to load a news article from the candidate list, extract outbound links, and follow them). If you want me to retry, please confirm and/or indicate which news article to try (for example: the Washington Post climate policy page or the BBC guide link above).
- Option B: You provide a specific news-article URL (from any outlet) and I will follow its links to find the three types of sources and report back.
- Option C: If you prefer, I can search for recent (past 12 months) news articles that explicitly cite a scientific study, a government policy, and an organizational statement, and list candidate articles for you to choose from. (But I will still need to fetch the article pages to extract and verify links.)

7) Technical note / transparency
- I cannot complete the link-following step because HTTP fetch attempts returned status=None (see error messages above). I will not fabricate content or attribute links without evidence.

If you want me to retry now, please tell me which option (A, B, or C) you prefer, or paste the news-article URL you'd like me to start from. If you want me to pick a specific article from the search-result candidates above, say which one and I'll attempt to fetch it again.
output.action_summary: I found candidate news/search-result pages (Washington Post climate policy, Nature climate-change policy subject page, an FSC blog post, and a BBC climate guide) via search, but attempts to fetch the selected news article and candidate source pages failed with HTTP fetch errors (status=None). Because I could not open the article, I could not extract or verify outbound links to a scientific paper, a government policy document, or an organization's position statement. I documented the search query, the candidate URLs, the steps attempted, the errors encountered, and provided recommended next steps (retry, provide a URL, or pick a candidate). I will proceed once you confirm how you'd like me to continue.

merged_results.title: Search for a recent news article about climate change that links to sources

result.query: recent news article climate change links to study government policy organization "climate change" "news" "linked"
result.intent: Find a recent (news) article about climate change that includes outbound links (or citations) to primary sources such as a scientific paper/study, a government policy document, and an organization position statement. Prioritize mainstream news outlets (NYT, BBC, The Guardian, Washington Post, Reuters, AP) and recent coverage (past 12 months).

results.title: Climate Politics & Policy - The Washington Post
results.description: The Lancet study examines how the dismantling of international aid by the U.S.

results.title: Climate-change policy - Latest research and news | Nature
results.description: Climate policy portfolios reduce ... (2000–2022) and finds that specialised instruments, long-term targets, and dedicated governmental bodies are linked to faster emission cuts....

results.title: 9 good news stories about climate change in 2025 | fsc.org
results.description: This portal collects data that supports monitoring and offers proof of organizations’ conservation practices. The portal gives auditors access to advanced data analysis, which helps to track: ... Better understanding enables quicker, more targeted action to protect the areas that need it most. There’s plenty of good climate news to celebrate: Government commitments, exciting new technologies, and corporate strategies designed to battle climate change.

results.title: What is climate change? A really simple guide
results.description: At COP29 in 2024, richer countries committed to giving developing nations at least $300bn (about £223bn) a year by 2035 to help them tackle climate change. But this is far less than poorer countries say they need.

No URLs, summaries, or explanations are given for the required sources — the agent only listed initial search-result candidate news URLs and reported HTTP fetch errors.
The agent did document the exploration path and errors clearly and provided reasonable next-step options, which is partial compliance with the task's procedural requirements.
